text: HI, what is the difference between a www site and a site without www

it's somewhat of a preference, here is the technical difference:

When you add www. in front of a site, it acts as a hostname which can help with flexibility with DNS, the ability to restrict cookies when using multiple subdomains, and more.

Whereas *non-WWW domains, also called 'naked domains', do not have a technical advantage*.

<https://www.benchmarkdesign.net/index.php/announcements/13/WWW-vs-Non-WWW-Which-is-Right-from-SEO-Perspective.html|Here's a full article with explanation>

It all comes down to preference, but you can also create a redirect from the non-www to the www or vice versa if you're concerned about how others will enter the site (as long as you have both configured properly in your DNS) - the same way that your http will redirect to https even if they don't type it.

Ok thanks <@U03AKL6Q1B2>.I have a site <http://www.legafrik.com|www.legafrik.com> but when users know <http://legafrik.com|legafrik.com> it does not work. So to solve this I added a secondary domain to redirect to <http://www.legafrik.com|www.legafrik.com>. It works but google talking about an SEO problem .I would like to know is this the right way to do it ?I am a bit confused
what SEO issue is Google raising for this? it looks like your redirects are setup correctly
thank you so much i understand better now
